Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk numactl
exit 0

islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk numactl-debuginfo
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: numactl bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The numactl packages provide a simple Non-Uniform Memory Access (NUMA) policy support. They consist of the numactl program to run other programs with a specific NUMA policy and the libnuma library to do allocations in applications using the NUMA policy. This update fixes the following bug: Previously, when calculating Non-Uniform Memory Access (NUMA) related information of a CPU, the "top" utility used the numa_node_of_cpu() function of libnuma.so. However, when node IDs were not contiguous, "top" returned incorrect NUMA information. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and "top" now shows correct NUMA information even if node IDs are not contiguous. (BZ#1238282) Users of numactl are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
